page.title: 15THE LEGEND OF JACK O'LEGS
page.content: In{1138}the legend of{Jack O'Legs}was born. Jack lived in a cave in the woods near Weston, Herts. This wood is now a cultivated field. Jack was as big as a giant. He was a local{hero. Like the tale of Robin Hood, Jack used to{rob the rich to feed the poor.}One day he stole bread from the baker at Baldock mill and was caught in the act he was clobbered and blinded. Before the hanging Jack asked if he could fire an arrow and wherever it landed he wanted to be buried. He is supposed to have fired it from Baldock and it landed in Weston churchyard, which is a distance of nearly three miles. There he was buried. Two stones mark his long grave set fourteen feet apart. He is reputed to be folded in three such was his great{Giant}height! The story may be based on the Second Earl of Pembroke, known as{Strongbow.
